intro: Gomphia deltoidea, commonly known as the delta gomphia, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its distinctive, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in summer, typically from December to March. Gomphia deltoidea thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas and riverine habitats. Its unique morphology and ecological adaptations make it an important component of its native ecosystems.
